    Mirror of pel...: probability distribution fitting with L-Moments

    annual.agg.pel.Rd

    Mirror of pel...: probability distribution fitting with L-Moments

    annual.agg.pel(
  distrib = c("exp", "gam", "gev", "glo", "gpa", "gno", "gum", "kap", "ln3", "nor",
    "pe3", "wak", "wei")[3],
  x,
  lmom,
  dd.name = "dd",
  dd_formatter = "D%03d",
  aggr.name = "aggr",
  alternative = c("two.sided", "less", "greater"),
  exact = NULL,
  nnx = names(x),
  ...
)

annual.agg.pel_x(x, ...)

annual.agg.pel_lmom(lmom, ...)

yearly.agg.pel(...)

yearly.agg.pel_x(x, ...)

yearly.agg.pel_lmom(lmom, ...)

    Arguments

    distrib

    character string incating the probability distribution to fit

    x

    object returned by annual.agg or yearly.agg or a vector which will be processed through vec2df

    lmom

    object returned by annual.agg.samlmu or yearly.agg.samlmu or annual.agg.idf.samlmu

    dd_formatter

    string formatter for duration in the function value

    aggr.name, dd.name

    optional column names for x and/or lmom. See function usage.

    alternative, exact

    arguments for ks.test

    nnx

    names of x

    ...

    further arguments

    Examples

    library(RMAWGEN)
data(trentino)
time <- as.Date(sprintf("%04d-%02d-%02d",PRECIPITATION$year,
                       PRECIPITATION$month,PRECIPITATION$day),format="%Y-%m-%d")
x <- PRECIPITATION$B8570

y <- annual.agg(x,dd=1:5,time) 
lmom <- annual.agg.samlmu(y)
lmrd(lmom)


out <- annual.agg.pel(distrib="gpa",x=y,lmom=lmom)
#> Warning: ties should not be present for the one-sample Kolmogorov-Smirnov test
#> Warning: ties should not be present for the one-sample Kolmogorov-Smirnov test
#> Warning: ties should not be present for the one-sample Kolmogorov-Smirnov test

## TEST VECTOR TYPE INPUT
y1 <- df2vec(y)
out1  <- annual.agg.pel(distrib="gpa",x=y1,lmom=lmom)
#> Warning: ties should not be present for the one-sample Kolmogorov-Smirnov test
#> Warning: ties should not be present for the one-sample Kolmogorov-Smirnov test
#> Warning: ties should not be present for the one-sample Kolmogorov-Smirnov test

if (!identical(out1,out)) stop("Something went wrong!")
